cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across the east-central Gulf, aiming for Florida’s Big Bend then moving quickly northeast along the southeast U.S. coast and into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near or just south of Apalachicola/Cedar Key)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass to Englewood, FL (includes Tampa Bay and Port Manatee area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast from Indian Pass through Tampa Bay southward to Englewood
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, higher gusts) possible Monday afternoon and evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft possible in Tampa Bay including Port Manatee during Monday high-tide cycle
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 in with isolated totals up to 8 in Monday into early Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday afternoon across west-central Florida
